questions.question: Let’s ……………………. your plans.
questions.description: Discuss is followed by a direct object without any preposition.

questions.question: She ……………………… a cousin of hers.
questions.description: Marry is followed by a direct object without any preposition.

questions.question: The baby …………………….. her mother.
questions.description: Resemble is followed by a direct object without any preposition.

questions.question: I will never forget meeting her …………………….. afternoon.
questions.description: Prepositions are often omitted before time expressions beginning this or that.

questions.question: The conference is ………………………. Friday.
questions.description: Prepositions are often omitted before time expressions beginning this or that.

questions.question: We met ……………………….. Friday in February.
questions.description: Prepositions are often omitted before time expressions beginning one.

questions.question: I was up ……………………. night.
questions.description: Prepositions are often omitted before time expressions beginning all.

questions.question: Susie has agreed to come …………………….. morning.
questions.description: Sometimes we leave out on before the names of the days of the week.

questions.question: He calls his mother three times ……………………. day.
questions.description: No preposition is used in the expression …. times a day.

questions.question: Private lessons cost 20 dollars ………………….. hour.
questions.description: No preposition is used in this expression.

questions.question: ………………………. day is your interview?
questions.description: In an informal style, we can leave out on before what day.

questions.question: …………………….. time does the train arrive?
questions.description: What time sounds more natural than at what time.
